User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Event Reporter application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

Report.title: Report
Report.description: Represents an event report created by a user.

uid.description: The ID of the user who created the report.

category.description: The category slug of the report.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the report was created.

formData.description: The data from the report form.

definition.description: Stores user profile information. Uses path-based authorization and role-based access. Only the user with the matching `userId` or an admin can read/write their own document.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user.

definition.description: Stores individual reports. Authorization is content-based: only the user whose `uid` matches the document's `uid` field or an admin can perform operations.

params.name: reportId
params.description: The unique identifier of the report.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure prioritizes security with role-based access control (RBAC). It uses custom claims for user roles (`admin`, `user`) to manage permissions centrally. This avoids complex, repetitive rule logic and enhances security.

*   **Users (`/users/{userId}`):** User profiles are secured so that only the owner or an admin can access them.
*   **Reports (`/reports/{reportId}`):** Report data access is restricted to the content owner (`uid` field) or an admin. List operations are secured to ensure users can only query their own reports, while admins can query all reports.

This design ensures secure data segregation and scalable permission management.
